symptoms.name: Otorrhea
symptoms.pattern: Chronic, may be serous or purulent due to secondary infection

symptoms.name: Otalgia
symptoms.pattern: Present in most cases, possibly due to pressure from granulation tissue

symptoms.name: Hearing loss
symptoms.severity: Severe to profound, mixed or conductive
symptoms.pattern: Early onset, may persist even after treatment

parameters.vital_signs: Normal vital signs in the reported case, but fever may be present
physical_findings: Posterior sagging of the ear canal with granulation tissue
Fluctuant, soft, and tender swelling behind the ear
Negative Rinne test on affected side (conductive hearing loss)
Weber test lateralized to the affected side
No palpable lymph nodes (although lymphadenopathy may be present in other cases)

lab_values.Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR): Elevated (80 mm/h in the reported case)
lab_values.Culture: May be negative or show no growth

risk_factors: Exposure to pathogenic microorganisms in airways
Underlying conditions like HIV, diabetes, or alcoholism

imaging_findings.High-resolution CT scan (HRCT): Soft tissue density in the external auditory canal, mesotympanum, and mastoid cavity; erosion of ossicles and bone structures; possible obliteration of parts of the facial nerve; thinning of the tegmen tympani

supportive: Imaging findings (bone erosion, soft tissue density)
Failure of standard treatment for otitis media
Positive tuberculin skin test or other evidence of active tuberculosis elsewhere in the body
